title: State Rep Candidates to Debate in Billerica, Wilmington
title_page: State Rep Candidates to Debate in Billerica, Wilmington
maintext:
LOWELL -- Candidates for state representative in two districts will meet in debates this week.
On Wednesday night, candidates in the 22nd Middlesex District debate starting at 7 p.m. at the Billerica Senior Center. Republican incumbent Marc Lombardo is challenged by Democrat Chris Tribou, and Matthew Mixon, who lists his affiliation as “Second American Revolution.” Lombardo and Tribou have accepted the invitation; Mixon has declined.
The seat represents the town of Billerica.
The debate is sponsored by The Sun and Billerica Access Television. The one-hour debate will be moderated by Tom Zuppa, The Sun’s managing editor/days. The event is open to the public. BATV will rebroadcast the debate.
On Thursday night, candidates in the 19th Middlesex District will debate at Wilmington High School.
Three candidates, all from Tewksbury, are seeking to succeed Rep. Jim Miceli, who died in April. They are: Republican Pina Prinzivalli, Democrat David Robertson, Miceli’s former aide, and independent Patricia Meuse. Robertson won a five-way primary in September, earning a ballot spot.
The district represents Tewksbury precincts 1, 1A, 2, 2A, 4, 4A and Wilmington precincts 1, 2, 4, 5, 6.
The debate will be broadcast live on Wilmington Community Television. Debate partners are The Sun, Wilmington-Tewksbury Chamber of Commerce, Wilmington Apple and Your Tewksbury Today. Sponsors are EBW Coin and Neighborhood Parcel Corp.
Candidates will be questioned by Robert Hayes of Wilmington Apple, Bill Gilman of Your Tewksbury Today, and Cassia Burns of the Town Crier. Zuppa will moderate.
The debate starts at 7 p.m. The public is invited.
